{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2994211,"name":"Stephen Le Viet","username":"StephenLe8714","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e9bcb4/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-18T23:24:27.964Z","cooked":"

Hi! I am from Rookie team 8714 and I need help on basic FRC programming.

I installed WPILib and opened up the TimedRobot template. In the program, I see functions such as autonomousInit(), teleopInit(), etc.
However, I don’t understand (1) how the robot switches between these modes and (2) how the robot enters autonomous mode right after the match starts.

Thank you so much,
Team 8714.

In driver station you have the option to select which mode you’re running (Auton, Teleop, Test). When you click enable, the initialization for that mode starts and then the periodic for the mode starts.

For at lab testing here is where you select which mode you’re running (this is in driver station):

During competition, they will take care of all the enabling on their side without having you click anything.

Hope that helps!

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2022-01-18T23:38:20.825Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":177,"readers_count":176,"score":60.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400690,"topic_slug":"basic-frc-programming-robot-workflow","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49561,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"retired"},"post_url":"/t/basic-frc-programming-robot-workflow/400690/2","custom_user_title":"retired","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2994231,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-18T23:38:54.741Z","cooked":"

Of note:

On the field, the FMS (Field Management System) will cause your Driver Station to enter a special mode, where the FMS gets to dictate what state your robot is put into. This is how it is ensured all robots start and stop at the same time (and the reason there’s rules about having different pieces of software up to date before competition).

The driver station supports a “practice” mode that will roughly simulate how the FMS clicks between disabled/teleop/auto over time:

image1538×351 70.1 KB

You can configure the timing here, if you desire to do some custom-length matches:

image1538×351 73 KB

As to the actual behind the scenes mechanics, that’s where your good friends at WPILib and NI come in. There is some documentation out there on it if you’re curious. But, the only thing you really have to know:

Right before auto starts, autonomousInit gets called once.

During Autonomous, autonomousPeriodic gets called every 20ms. Make sure your code reads inputs, does processing, updates outputs, and gets out of the way in less than 20ms.

The same goes for teleop and disabled, with their similarly-named functions.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2022-01-18T23:39:39.916Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":138.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":400690,"topic_slug":"basic-frc-programming-robot-workflow","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://wpilib.screenstepslive.com/s/fms/m/whitepaper/l/608744-fms-whitepaper","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"FMS Whitepaper | FMS Whitepaper | FMS Documentation","clicks":21},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/b/0/b08b1f0b03059fc977df4f35ac1854e0617b2fe9.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0},{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/uploads/default/original/3X/d/8/d83de77d636c22c8a6515acb59119d774de11f45.png","internal":true,"reflection":false,"clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/basic-frc-programming-robot-workflow/400690/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2994235,"name":"Stephen Le Viet","username":"StephenLe8714","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e9bcb4/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-01-18T23:43:19.367Z","cooked":"

Thank you so much for your explanation!

Please correct me if I’m wrong:

  • The robot will be placed on the FIELD at the beginning of the match.
  • The match starts and the robot will automatically enters Autonomous mode.
  • Autonomous period ends, then the robot will automatically enters Teleoperated mode.

Thank you,
Team 8714.

Yep you got it!

Extra details:

  • Drivers are told to stand behind a line (about 4-5 feet from driver station) before autonomous is started
  • Robot enters teleop 3 seconds after autonomous ends in order to give time for drivers to reach station
","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2022-01-18T23:47:08.255Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":122,"readers_count":121,"score":84.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":400690,"topic_slug":"basic-frc-programming-robot-workflow","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":50119,"username":"StephenLe8714","name":"Stephen Le Viet","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/e9bcb4/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49561,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"retired"},"post_url":"/t/basic-frc-programming-robot-workflow/400690/5","custom_user_title":"retired","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":2994250,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2022-01-18T23:56:18.830Z","cooked":"

Most critically, “automatic” in this context is correct in the sense that you don’t have to write the code to change the robot’s mode. Others already have taken care of that. Just fill out the teleop/autonomous functions with your desired functionality, and the FMS/Driver Station take care of the rest.

Check out this example for reference.

To add to the explanations already given, I’m a bit proponent of digging through code to understand something. In line with that, here’s where that logic happens: https://github.com/wpilibsuite/allwpilib/blob/main/wpilibj/src/main/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj/IterativeRobotBase.java#L258. This method has a lot of extra stuff in it, but you’ll notice all the familiar method names being called (autonomousInit, teleopPeriodic, etc). Also, there’s a comment block at the top of the class that describes what gets called when.
